title: Will INFJs always be expressing their feelings? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, no. Many INFJs are very expressive for two reasons: It feels authentic to them. Why should we actively suppress our excitement? Because everyone else says we should? Sorry, but we can’t do that. However, I’m more than certain there are many INFJs out there who don’t feel the need to be expressive. You might just be one of them.They feel emotions very deeply, especially those who embrace their Fe (or Empathy). Since these emotions are usually intense more often than not, we have a rather hard time holding them back.If you don’t end up being very expressive, it doesn’t necessarily mean you’re not an INFJ. Whenever I leave my home and go to someplace public (like a supermarket or park), you could easily mistake me for an INTJ or INTP. I keep to myself, I’m always looking around and I never talk. Once I do talk to you, you’ll be able to feel my empathy. But that doesn’t happen very often. This is actually a common skill of INFJs: Mimicking other personality types, often unwittingly. If you’re an INFJ, your level of expressiveness heavily depends on where you are and how you feel. If you’re around select people (family or friends), you might feel more comfortable and therefore be more expressive. When you’re in public, some social parts of you may shut down and reroute your focus to the barrage of emotions you’re about to stand under. Take that into account when you think about this. And even after all of that, I don’t believe that being expressive is crucial to the INFJ baseline personality. If you find that nearly everything else about INFJs fit you, including the way you feel, I wouldn’t worry about this one little thing. That said, there is always a chance you’re not an INFJ, or a borderline between two different types. I feel like I should remind you to be honest with yourself involving these kinds of tests. First realize who you are, then find ways to build yourself into your ideal. Don’t answer them as if you were your ideal. Be honest. Hope this helps.
